original: khyab pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / @108a * //
analyzed: khyab pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyad pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa dang / mkhas pa'i dmigs pa dang / @108a * //
translated: the pervasive object, the object of purifying conduct, the object of expertise,

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par spyod pa'i dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gtod pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par spyod pa'i dmigs pa la dran pa nye bar gtod pa yin no //

original: zhes ji skad sngar bstan pa yin te /

translated: The fact that mindfulness is well-established by these three causes is called the establishment of mindfulness.

original: de la tshor ba gang zhe na ;
analyzed: de la tshor ba gang zhe na ;
translated: What is feeling?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba de ba yang ma yin par tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba de ba yang ma yin par tshor ba'o //

original: de la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa yang lus kyi'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa yang lus kyi'o //
translated: Pleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant feelings are bodily.

original: lus kyi ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus kyi ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as bodily feelings are, so are mental feelings.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa yang zang zing dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa yang zang zing dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Pleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant feelings are also worldly.

original: zang zing med pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zang zing med pa yang de dang 'dra'o //

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhen pa la brten pa dang / nges par 'byung ba la brten pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba zhen pa la brten pa dang / nges par 'byung ba la brten pa yang de dang 'dra ste /

original: de dag ni tshor ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /
analyzed: de dag ni tshor ba rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /
translated: These are the twenty-one types of sensation.

original: rnam ba dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam ba dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, they are nine types.

original: de la sems gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems gang zhe na /
translated: What is mind?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhes sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / kun du bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhes sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / kun du bsdus pa dang /
translated: The mind is either associated with attachment or free from attachment, associated with aversion or free from aversion, associated with delusion or free from delusion, contracted or distracted,

original: rnam par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang / rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu bzung ba dang / rgod pa dang / rgod pa ma yin pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Distraction, slackness, excessive exertion, excitation, non-excitation, pacification, non-pacification, meditative equipoise, non-meditative equipoise,

original: legs par bsgoms pa dang / legs bar bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: legs par bsgoms pa dang / legs bar bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: well-cultivated, not well-cultivated, well-liberated mind, and not well-liberated mind.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni sems rnam pa nyi shu yin no //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni sems rnam pa nyi shu yin no //
translated: These are summarized as twenty types of mind.

original: de la chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena here?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / zhe sdang dang / zhes sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / zhe sdang dang / zhes sdang 'dul ba dang / gti mug dang / gti mug 'dul ba dang / kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / zhum pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Attachment and the taming of attachment, aversion and the taming of aversion, delusion and the taming of delusion, contraction, distraction, slackness, excessive exertion,ğŸ”½excitation, non-excitation, pacification, non-pacification, meditative equipoise, non-meditative equipoise,ğŸ”½well-cultivated, not well-cultivated, well-liberated mind, and not well-liberated mind.

original: rgod pa @108b dang ; rgod pa ma yin pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa dang / legs par mnyam par gzhag pa dang / legs par mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa dang / lam legs bar bsgoms pa dang /
analyzed: rgod pa @108b dang ; rgod pa ma yin pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa dang / legs par mnyam par gzhag pa dang / legs par mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa dang / lam legs bar bsgoms pa dang /
translated: good meditative concentration and non-meditative concentration,ğŸ”½good cultivation of the path and non-cultivation of the path,

original: lam legs par bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: lam legs par bsgoms pa ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: and complete liberation and non-liberation.

original: de dag ni nag po dang / dkar po'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos nyi shu yin par rig par bya'o //ğŸ”½de la bde bar tshor ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten te /
analyzed: de dag ni nag po dang / dkar po'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi chos nyi shu yin par rig par bya'o // de la bde bar tshor ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten te /
translated: These should be understood as the twenty dharmas on the side of affliction and purification that are posited as the dark and bright sides.

original: skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Among them, pleasant feeling is the aspect of feeling that arises in dependence on contact that will experience pleasure.

original: bde bar tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is whatever is pleasant feeling.ğŸ”½Unpleasant feeling is the aspect of feeling that arises in dependence on contact that will experience suffering.ğŸ”½It is whatever is unpleasant feeling.

original: de yang rnam par shes ba'i tshogs lnga dang / mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes ba'i tshogs lnga dang / mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyi'o //
translated: The pleasant bodily feeling is that which is associated with the five collections of consciousness.ğŸ”½The pleasant mental feeling is that which is associated with the mental consciousness.ğŸ”½The unpleasant feeling is that which is associated with the five collections of consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi'o //ğŸ”½bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba las ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi'o // bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba las ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: The unpleasant mental feeling is that which is associated with the mental consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten te /ğŸ”½skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rnam pa bde ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten te / skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rnam pa bde ba yang ma yin /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is that which arises in dependence on contact that is neither painful nor pleasant.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is also like this.

original: de ni sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin no //
translated: It is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tsher ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tsher ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyi'o //
translated: The pleasant bodily feeling is that which is associated with the five collections of consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi'o //ğŸ”½mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa nges par 'byed pa las byung ba /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi'o // mya ngan las 'das pa dang mthun pa nges par 'byed pa las byung ba /
translated: That which is associated with the mental consciousness is of the mind.ğŸ”½That which is conducive to nirvana, which arises from the factors conducive to penetration,

original: shin tu mthar thug pa dang shin tu dri ma med pa dang / shin tu tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zang zing med pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa dang shin tu dri ma med pa dang / shin tu tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni zang zing med pa yin no //
translated: which is very ultimate, very stainless, and very pure in conduct, is disinterested.

original: khams su gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni zang zing dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: khams su gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni zang zing dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That which belongs to the realms is interested.

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / ldan pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rjes su mthun pa gang yin pa de ni nges par 'byung ba la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / ldan pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rjes su mthun pa gang yin pa de ni nges par 'byung ba la brten pa yin no //
translated: That which is conducive to the form and formless realms, and is conducive to detachment, is based on renunciation.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rjes su mi mthun pa gang yin pa @109a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rjes su mi mthun pa gang yin pa @109a * //
translated: That which is conducive to the desire realm, and is not conducive to detachment,

original: de ni zhes pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhes pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: is based on worldly purity.

original: de la sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: A mind that is associated with attachment is that which is completely bound by attachment to a thing that causes attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba gang yin ba'o ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba gang yin ba'o ;
translated: A mind that is free from attachment is that which is free from the bondage of attachment.

original: ; zhe sdang dang bcas pa ni zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa'i gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ; zhe sdang dang bcas pa ni zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa'i gang yin pa'o //
translated: A mind that is associated with aversion is that which is completely bound by aversion to a thing that causes aversion.

original: zhes sdang dang bral ba ni zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes sdang dang bral ba ni zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: A mind that is free from aversion is that which is free from the bondage of aversion.

original: de la gti mug dang bcas pa ni rmongs par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gti mug dang bcas pa ni rmongs par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: A mind that is associated with confusion is that which is completely bound by confusion to a thing that causes confusion.

original: gti mug dang bral ba ni gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba ni gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: A mind that is free from confusion is that which is free from the bondage of confusion.

original: sems drug po de dag ni rgyu ba dang ldan pa dag yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems drug po de dag ni rgyu ba dang ldan pa dag yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that these six types of mind are associated with movement.

original: de la gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de la gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Three are on the side of affliction.

original: gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Three are on the side of the antidote to affliction.

original: de la sems kun du bsdus pa ni zhi gnas kyi rnam pas nang gi dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems kun du bsdus pa ni zhi gnas kyi rnam pas nang gi dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, mental contraction is the inward orientation on an internal object through the aspect of calm abiding.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag gis rjes su zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag gis rjes su zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Distraction is the pursuit of the five external sense-qualities.

original: de la sems zhum pa ni rmugs ba dang gnyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //ğŸ”½rab tu bzung ba ni dang bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa la yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems zhum pa ni rmugs ba dang gnyid dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o // rab tu bzung ba ni dang bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa la yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, mental depression is the association with lethargy and sleepiness.ğŸ”½Mental expansion is the delight in the object of faith.

original: sems rgod pa ni ha cang yang dag par gzung pa'i phyir rgod pas kun nas dkris pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems rgod pa ni ha cang yang dag par gzung pa'i phyir rgod pas kun nas dkris pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Mental excitement is the entanglement with excitement due to excessive grasping.

original: sems rgod pa ma yin pa ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang / kun du sdud pa'i dus la btang snyoms su 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems rgod pa ma yin pa ni rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang / kun du sdud pa'i dus la btang snyoms su 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that is not excited is indifferent when it is time to be very attentive and when it is time to be concentrated.

original: de la sems nye bar zhi ba ni sgrib pa dag las rnam par grol ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems nye bar zhi ba ni sgrib pa dag las rnam par grol ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that is tranquil is liberated from the obscurations.

original: nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa ni rnam par ma grol ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa ni rnam par ma grol ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that is not tranquil is not liberated.

original: de la sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni sgrib pa dag las rnam par grol ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi la zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni sgrib pa dag las rnam par grol ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi la zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that is concentrated is engaged in the actual meditative development of the meditative absorption because it is liberated from the obscurations.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa ni ma zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa ni ma zhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that is not concentrated is not engaged.

original: de la sems legs par bsgoms ba ni yun ring po nas ting nge 'dzin de nyid la yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i phyir myur du @109b snyoms par 'jug pa ci 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang / dka' ba med par thob pa dang / tshegs med par thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems legs par bsgoms ba ni yun ring po nas ting nge 'dzin de nyid la yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i phyir myur du @109b snyoms par 'jug pa ci 'dod pa bzhin thob pa dang / dka' ba med par thob pa dang / tshegs med par thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mind that is well cultivated is one that quickly enters meditative attainment, as desired, and is attained without difficulty and without hardship, because it has been well refined for a long time in that very meditative concentration.

original: de la sems legs par bsgoms pa ma yin pa ni de las bzlogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems legs par bsgoms pa ma yin pa ni de las bzlogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mind that is not well cultivated should be understood as the opposite of that.

original: de la sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni thams cad dang gtan du rnam par grol ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ni thams cad dang gtan du rnam par grol ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the mind that is completely liberated is that which is completely liberated from all and forever.

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ni thams cad dang tan du rnam par grol ba ma yin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa ni thams cad dang tan du rnam par grol ba ma yin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The mind that is not completely liberated is that which is not completely liberated from all and forever.

original: sems bcu bzhi po de dag ni spyod par gtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems bcu bzhi po de dag ni spyod par gtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These fourteen minds should be understood as belonging to the stage of conduct.

original: de la sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i sa las brtsams pa'i spyon par gtogs pa'i sems ni brgyad de /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i sa las brtsams pa'i spyon par gtogs pa'i sems ni brgyad de /
translated: Among them, the eight minds belonging to the stage of conduct that begin with the stage of purification of obscurations are:

original: kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa'i bar dag go //
analyzed: kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba ma yin pa'i bar dag go //
translated: the contracted, the distracted, the pacified, and the not pacified.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams pa'i spyod par gtogs pa'i sems ni drug ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams pa'i spyod par gtogs pa'i sems ni drug ste /
translated: The six minds belonging to the stage of conduct that begin with the purification of afflictions are:ğŸ”½the afflicted, the unafflicted, the liberated, the not liberated, the completely liberated, and the not completely liberated.

original: shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'i bar dag go //ğŸ”½nang na sgrib pa yod pa na yang bdag la sgrib pa yod do zhes rab tu shes pa dang / sgrib pa med na yang bdag la sgrib pa med do zhes rab tu shes pa dang / sgrib pa ma skyes pa ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba de yang rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par grol ba dang / shin tu rnam par grol ba ma yin pa'i bar dag go // nang na sgrib pa yod pa na yang bdag la sgrib pa yod do zhes rab tu shes pa dang / sgrib pa med na yang bdag la sgrib pa med do zhes rab tu shes pa dang / sgrib pa ma skyes pa ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba de yang rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: and the one who is completely liberated and the one who is not completely liberated.ğŸ”½â€œWhen there is obscuration, he knows that there is obscuration; when there is no obscuration, he knows that there is no obscuration; he knows how the obscuration that has not arisen comes to arise;ğŸ”½he knows how the obscuration that has arisen comes to an end; he knows how the nonarising of the obscuration in the future comes about.

original: skyes pa dang ji ltar 'bral bar 'gyur ba de yang rab tu shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / de la mig gi kun du sbyor ba dang / yid kyi bar gyi kun du sbyor ba yod na yang bdag la yid kyi bar gyi kun du sbyor ba yod do zhes rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ji ltar 'bral bar 'gyur ba de yang rab tu shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / de la mig gi kun du sbyor ba dang / yid kyi bar gyi kun du sbyor ba yod na yang bdag la yid kyi bar gyi kun du sbyor ba yod do zhes rab tu shes pa dang /

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag kyang 'das pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i yul la @113b dmigs te skye'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag kyang 'das pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i yul la @113b dmigs te skye'o //
translated: These bad, unwholesome defilements arise with reference to a past object, with reference to a future object, or with reference to a present object.

original: de dag kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa dang / mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa dang / mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: They also arise with reference to a hidden object and with reference to a manifest object.

original: gang dag 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos bo la dmigs pa de dag ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos bo la dmigs pa de dag ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Those that arise with reference to a past or future object are with reference to a hidden object.

original: gang dag da ltar byung pa'i yul la dmigs pa de dag ni mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag da ltar byung pa'i yul la dmigs pa de dag ni mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Those that arise with reference to a present object are with reference to a manifest object.

original: de la lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spangs ba'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spangs ba'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //
translated: He strives to prevent the arising of nonvirtuous phenomena that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have arisen, in relation to objects that are hidden.

original: mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa ma skyed pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa ma skyed pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin te /
translated: He exerts himself to prevent the arising of those that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have arisen, in relation to objects that are evident.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa shin tu brtan pos mi skyed pa dang / spangs bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa shin tu brtan pos mi skyed pa dang / spangs bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is firmly engaged in the practice of effort, he does not allow them to arise and he abandons them.

original: gzhan yang kun nas dkris pa chung ngu dang / 'bring po ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang kun nas dkris pa chung ngu dang / 'bring po ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni 'bad par byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, he strives to prevent the arising of those that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have arisen, in relation to the minor and middling forms of the mental afflictions.

original: kun nas dkris pa chen po ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams sbang ba'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa chen po ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams sbang ba'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed pa yin no //
translated: He exerts himself in striving to prevent the arising of the great fetters that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have already arisen.

original: gal te 'das pa'i dmigs pa la spyod par byed na yang de la dmigs pa des ci nas kyang nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod par byed do //
analyzed: gal te 'das pa'i dmigs pa la spyod par byed na yang de la dmigs pa des ci nas kyang nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod par byed do //
translated: If he engages in the objective support of the past, he engages in it in such a way that the defilements do not arise on account of that objective support.

original: gal te brjed ngas  pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur na yang de dang du mi len cing spong bar byed /
analyzed: gal te brjed ngas  pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur na yang de dang du mi len cing spong bar byed /

original: sel bar byed /
analyzed: sel bar byed /

original: byang bar byed do //
analyzed: byang bar byed do //

analyzed: 'das pa'i dmigs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i dmigs pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: As with the objective support of the past, so it is with the objective support of the future.

original: de ltar na de sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'bad par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'bad par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, he is said to strive to prevent the arising of evil unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen and to abandon those that have already arisen.

original: gal te da ltar byung ba'i dmigs pa la spyod par byed na yang de la dmigs pa des ci nas kyang nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod par byed do //
analyzed: gal te da ltar byung ba'i dmigs pa la spyod par byed na yang de la dmigs pa des ci nas kyang nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar spyod par byed do //
translated: If he engages with the object of present time, he engages with it in such a way that the mental afflictions will not arise.

original: gal te brjed ngas pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur na yang skyes pa de dang du mi len cing /
analyzed: gal te brjed ngas pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur na yang skyes pa de dang du mi len cing /
translated: If they do arise due to forgetfulness, he does not consent to their arising.

original: spong bar byed /ğŸ”½sel bar byed /
analyzed: spong bar byed / sel bar byed /
translated: He abandons them,ğŸ”½removes them,

original: byang bar byed de /ğŸ”½de ltar na de sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spang pa'i phyir brtson @114a * //

translated: and eliminates them.

analyzed: 'grus rtsom par byed pa zhes bya'o // gzhan yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gang dag kun du rtog ba'i dbang kho nas skye la /

translated: Moreover, there are evil, nonvirtuous qualities that arise only through the power of imagination and not through the power of an object.

analyzed: de la kun du rtog pa'i dbang kho na skye la /

analyzed: yul gyi stobs kyis ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa yang gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni gang dag thob pa dang / mngon du gyur pa rnams te /

analyzed: 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom mang nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: one is posited as an approacher to the supreme result of an arhat.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de yang @122a * //
translated: The BhagavÄn also said that the result of once-returner

analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug bsrabs pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag go //

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu ni tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The result of non-returning is established as the abandonment of the five lower fetters.

analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ni nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su gtugs par spangs pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag ste /

analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la gang dag 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / rnam par rtog pa spyad pa de dag gis ni ;

analyzed: re zhig dang po kho nar spyad pa rnam par sbyor ba'i dmigs pa la spyad pa rnam par spyong bar bya ste /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems gnas pa rtogs par 'gyur zhing /

original: sbyor ba rab tu dbye ba ni rtag tu byed pa dang / tu rtag tu mi byed pa dang / gus par byed pa dang / gus par mi byed par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rab tu dbye ba ni rtag tu byed pa dang / tu rtag tu mi byed pa dang / gus par byed pa dang / gus par mi byed par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The distinction of application is the distinction of those who apply themselves constantly and respectfully and those who do not.

original: dus kyi rab tu dbye ba ni yun ring po nas lam bsgoms pa dang / yun ring po na lam ma bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: dus kyi rab tu dbye ba ni yun ring po nas lam bsgoms pa dang / yun ring po na lam ma bsgoms pa'o //
translated: The division of time is the long cultivation of the path and the non-cultivation of the path for a long time.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag ji ltar na gang zag brgyad rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ra gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag ji ltar na gang zag brgyad rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ra gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do these four divisions serve as the cause for the establishment of the eight persons?

original: de la dbang po yongs su smin pa gang yin pa de ni nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dbang po yongs su smin pa gang yin pa de ni nus pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the full maturation of the faculties is the ability.

original: dbang pi'o yongs su ma smin pa zhi mi nus pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang pi'o yongs su ma smin pa zhi mi nus pa yin no //
translated: The non-full maturation of the faculties is the inability.

original: rnal 'byor shes pa ni thams la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor shes pa ni thams la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Knowledge of yoga is skill in all.

original: rnal 'byor mi shes pa ni thams la mi mthas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mi shes pa ni thams la mi mthas pa yin no //
translated: Non-knowledge of yoga is non-skill in all.

original: rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byas te sbyor ba ni rgyun du byed pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byas te sbyor ba ni rgyun du byed pa ste /
translated: Constant practice and respectful application are constant practice.

original: rtag 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called constant effort.

original: rtag tu mi byed pa dang / gus par mi byed par sbyor ba ni rgyun du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu mi byed pa dang / gus par mi byed par sbyor ba ni rgyun du mi byed pa ste /
translated: Constant non-practice and disrespectful application are non-constant practice.

original: rtag 'grus med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag 'grus med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called non-constant effort.

original: yun ring po nas lam bsgoms pa ni yongs su sbyong ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: yun ring po nas lam bsgoms pa ni yongs su sbyong ba byas pa yin no //
translated: One who has cultivated the path for a long time is one who has completed the purifications.

original: yun ring po nas lam ma bsgoms pa ni yongs su sbyong ba ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: yun ring po nas lam ma bsgoms pa ni yongs su sbyong ba ma byas pa yin te /
translated: One who has not cultivated the path for a long time is one who has not completed the purifications.

original: de ltar dbang po'i rab tu dbye ba dang / rnal 'byor dang / sbyor ba dang / dus kyi rab tu dbye bas gang zag brgyad rnam par gzag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po'i rab tu dbye ba dang / rnal 'byor dang / sbyor ba dang / dus kyi rab tu dbye bas gang zag brgyad rnam par gzag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the eight persons are distinguished by the distinctions of faculties, yoga, application, and time.

original: gang zag gang ji srid du dbang po yongs su ma smin pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zag gang ji srid du dbang po yongs su ma smin pa de ni /
translated: The person who has not matured his faculties
